avalancheActivity.highlights: Little snow is left in the mountains and the remaining snow has gotten stiff and more stable after the frost started. New snow is expected in E-winds on Thursday that could drift and form wind slabs in W-facing hills.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow melted away widely in the warming episode last week. Some snow remains however in certain places in the mountains but that snow has gotten stiff and stable after freezing started again. The snowpack is therefore likely homogenous and strong. New snow is expected on Thursday in strong E-winds. Binding with the older snow will likely be weak to begin with and western facing hills could be especially dangerous as wind slabs could form.

travelAdvisory.comment: Windslabs have formed widely in southern facing hills in the north and east of the country after the storm on Tuesday and the snowpack is currently considered unstable. Intense but short burst of snowfall is expected in E-winds on Thursday in the SW corner and the snow could be unstable to begin with.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Windslabs have formed widely in the N and E of the country after the storm on Tuesday and the snowpack is currently considered unstable. Snowfall is expected in E-winds on Thursday in the SW corner.

weatherForecast.highlights: Norðan strekkingur út þriðjudag með möguleika á éljabökkum. Lægir með miðvikudeginum en hvöss A-átt með snjókomu á fimmtudag. Frost víða -12 til -15 til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Thin covering of snow is on top of older snow, which is considered stable. Small windslabs could form on SW aspects in the next few days.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Little snow is in the area. Thin covering of snow is now on top of older snow, which is considered homogenous and stable. The new snow might form windslabs on SW aspects in the next few days but these windslabs would be thin and small.

travelAdvisory.comment: Windslabs have formed widely in southern facing hills in the north and east of the country after the storm on Tuesday and the snowpack is currently considered unstable. Intense but short burst of snowfall is expected in E-winds on Thursday in the SW corner and the snow could be unstable to begin with.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Windslabs have formed widely in the N and E of the country after the storm on Tuesday and the snowpack is currently considered unstable. Snowfall is expected in E-winds on Thursday in the SW corner.

weatherForecast.highlights: N-A 5-13 m/s og líkur á dálítilli snjókomu. Áfram kalt í veðri.

avalancheActivity.comment: 3 wet avalanches fell in Héðinsfjörður likely in the warm episode of last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snowfall is expected in N-winds the next days. Snow will drift and form wind-slabs in S-facing hills and the new snow will likely be unstable the first days after the storm.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The older snow has been through freeze-thaw cycles and gotten stable but new snow is expected in strong N-winds on Wednesday. More snow is then expected in mild winds throughout the week. The thawing from last week propably had less effect on the snowpack high in the mountains, resulting in a steep temperature gradient when the frost returned with possible faceting of weak layers. Snowfall will be intense on Tuesday and the new snow could be unstable the first days after the storm. Wind slabs will likely form in S facing hills.

travelAdvisory.comment: Windslabs have formed widely in southern facing hills in the north and east of the country after the storm on Tuesday and the snowpack is currently considered unstable. Intense but short burst of snowfall is expected in E-winds on Thursday in the SW corner and the snow could be unstable to begin with.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Windslabs have formed widely in the N and E of the country after the storm on Tuesday and the snowpack is currently considered unstable. Snowfall is expected in E-winds on Thursday in the SW corner.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hvöss N-átt allt að 30 m/sek til fjalla með talsverðri snjókomu á þriðjudag. Snjókoma heldur áfram yfir miðvikudag en dregur úr ákefð og vind lægir. Lítilsháttar snjókoma í hægri N-átt á fimmtudag. Hitastig í kringum -14 upp til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.comment: Slab avalanches occurred in Lambeyrardalur above Eskifjörður and in Bagall in Norðfjörður on Jan 8th. Many small loose avalanches occurred the same day around Eskifjörður and Norðfjörður.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Considerable new snow is widely in the area and blowing snow has been observed. Windslabs have most likely formed which could be unstable. Weak layers could be present in the snowpack.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable new snow arrived on Tuesday during N/NW wind with blowing snow that accumulated on the lee side. Snowfall is forecasted until Wednesday morning, heavy snowfall in places, but decreasing precipitation during the day. Windslabs have most likely formed which could be unstable to begin with. The new snow could bond poorly together and sporatic weak layers could be present in older snow. Ongoing cold weather is forecasted which could increase instability in the snowpack.

travelAdvisory.comment: Windslabs have formed widely in southern facing hills in the north and east of the country after the storm on Tuesday and the snowpack is currently considered unstable. Intense but short burst of snowfall is expected in E-winds on Thursday in the SW corner and the snow could be unstable to begin with.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Windslabs have formed widely in the N and E of the country after the storm on Tuesday and the snowpack is currently considered unstable. Snowfall is expected in E-winds on Thursday in the SW corner.

weatherForecast.highlights: N/NV 10-18 m/s á miðvikudag og snjókoma með köflum, sums staðar mikil ákefð um morguninn, en dregur úr úrkomu með deginum. NA-læg átt um tíma. Dregur úr vindi og léttir til á fimmtudag og föstudag. Áfram kalt í veðri.
